task.title: Installing SAXON on Windows
task.shortdesc: How to install SAXON in the Windows operating environment. Install either SAXON or Xalan: you do not need both.

prolog.author: Jen Linton
JoAnn Hackos
Kylene Bruski
Anna van Raaphorst
Richard Johnson
prolog.publisher: OASIS (Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards)

step.cmd: From SAXON: The XSLT and XQuery Processor page, scroll to find the heading Saxon 6.5.5

step.stepresult: The SourceForge.net page opens with a list of download options.

step.cmd: Select any of the images to start the download.
step.info: If SAXON does not appear to be downloading, wait a few minutes before selecting another image. You may have to select more than one image until you find one that works. If you are an Internet Explorer user and a yellow bar appears at the top of the screen with the message, "To help protect your security, Internet Explorer blocked this site from downloading files to your computer. Click here for options..," click on the bar and select "Download File."

step.cmd: Click Save to unzip the Saxon 6.5.5.zip file and save it to the C:\ directory as saxon.
Set the CLASSPATH environment variable for the saxon.jar files.
